title-group.article-title: Preliminary Evaluation of a Membrane-Based System for Removing CO from Air

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1991 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: Processes to remove and/or recover CO₂ from air are essential to the long-term success of the U.S. space program. In this paper, the results of a preliminary investigation of the use of a novel membranebased system for removal of CO₂ from air are presented. Features of this technology that make it attractive include the following: 1) it is lightweight, 2) it requires no consumables or expendables, 3) it is relatively simple, and 4) it does not rely directly on other subsystems. Preliminary designs of systems for removing CO₂ from spacecraft cabin atmospheres and from the extravehicular mobility unit (EMU) are presented.
